result.execSummary:
The defendant Leah M. Schindler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Have no contact with Walmart.


Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Contact with Robert Collins only as approved by the agent.

Any other counseling, treatment, assessments as recommended by the agent.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
To Walmart, joint and several with Robert Collins.

timeConds.notes: Under the Huber Law, on count 1 only, stayed and to be imposed at the agent's discretion and upon order of the court.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Christin Saint Pierre through Public Defender
Re:  PTC Retail Theft, on 01-05-22.
Order to report to MTPD for photo and prints

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of retail theft and 2 cts. bail jumping.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 02-03-22 at 10:30 a.m.  Bail is set at $500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release and defendant is to have no contact with Walmart.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
